value: — Tree-lined streets with well-preserved brownstones typify this former dockworkers' town overlooking the Hudson. Yuppies are taking over Hoboken's old Italian and Irish neighborhoods, but the city still has the highest number of bars per square mile in the country! Birthplace of Frank Sinatra and the location of the world's first baseball game.

, New Jersey's second largest city is undergoing a large-scale urban renaissance attracting a large yuppie population.  The development of commercial skyscrapers in the Newport and Paulus Hook areas earned the city the nickname of "Wall Street West."  Known for its ethnic diversity, Jersey City is becoming an increasingly cosmopolitan area.
